title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top 2026 NFL Draft prospect, hopes to be mentored by Tom Brady at the Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, 22, led Indiana Hoosiers to a national title; won Heisman and multiple MVP awards last season.
Brady, co-owner of Raiders, and Mendoza briefly spoke; Mendoza eager to meet and learn from him in person.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' featuring Jennifer Lopez is now streaming on Hulu.
'Bridgerton' Season 4, focusing on Benedict Bridgerton, is available on Netflix.
'Paradise' Season 2 featuring Sterling K. Brown is streaming on Hulu.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided pursuing a fly ball during a Red Sox spring training game.
Despite the collision, both players remained in the game and contributed offensively, hitting against former teammate Chris Sale.
Manager Alex Cora attributed the incident to miscommunication between Anthony and Rafaela in the outfield.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund when a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
The Jimmy Fund supports cancer care and research at Boston's Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
Cora's previous donations include $10,407.96 and $10,777 based on Red Sox wins and runs in 2021.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, banning certain teachings like critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in schools.
The bill passed 184-164, with just four Republicans opposing, and now moves to the Senate for further debate.
Teachers violating the bill could face credential revocation and schools may be sued for up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Route 2 in North Adams features colorful icicles, a local tradition involving food coloring, delighting motorists on the Mohawk Trail.
The Hairpin Turn's icicles are created using water balloons or supersoakers with colored water, a custom lasting decades.
Nearby attractions include the Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA, among the largest contemporary art museums in the U.S.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts reports first 2026 measles cases in a school-aged child and Greater Boston adult.
The infected adult returned from abroad with unclear vaccination status, potentially exposing others in Greater Boston.
Nationwide, 1,136 measles cases confirmed in 2026; Massachusetts officials encourage vaccination to prevent spread.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, a lifelong South Boston resident, passed away peacefully on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
Morgan worked for Boston Inspectional Services and was known for her kindness and love for fashion, earning the nickname "Hollywood."
She is survived by husband Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and a large extended family who cherish her memory.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Her father, a former Boston salesman, passed away from ALS, a disease she hopes to raise awareness about.
Hamilton aims to honor her father's legacy and support ALS research by participating in the marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio has filed an emergency motion with the Supreme Judicial Court regarding her audit lawsuit.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell moved to dismiss DiZoglio's lawsuit, questioning the auditor's authority to bypass her office.
DiZoglio argues a conflict of interest in Campbell's response and seeks a special assistant attorney general for representation.
